title: Karpathy's thread on AI coding hit different. Bottleneck shifted from implementation to prompting
description: Reddit discussion about Andrej Karpathy's insights on AI coding. The conversation highlights how the bottleneck in development has shifted from writing code to prompting, context management, and reviewing AI outputs. Developers discuss the rapid evolution of AI coding tools and how it's changing the skillset required for software engineering.
author: Reddit r/programming community

title: Claude Code Advanced Masterclass in Under 81 Mins
description: YouTube video by Carl Vellotti providing an advanced masterclass on Claude Code. The video focuses on teaching product managers and developers how to leverage Claude Code effectively. This is a follow-up to his first episode which hit 30,000 views, indicating strong interest in AI coding tools.
author: Carl Vellotti

title: First impressions of Claude Cowork, Anthropic's general agent
description: Simon Willison reviews Claude Cowork, Anthropic's new general agent that extends Claude Code capabilities beyond developer tools. Key insights: 1) Cowork is Claude Code wrapped in a non-developer-friendly interface with filesystem sandbox, 2) Uses Apple Virtualization Framework (VZVirtualMachine) with custom Linux root filesystem for security, 3) Simon tested it analyzing his blog drafts - it ran 44 searches and found unpublished articles ready for publication, 4) Prompt injection risks remain a concern - Anthropic warns users to watch for 'suspicious actions', 5) Simon predicts Gemini and OpenAI will follow suit with similar offerings. The article includes detailed technical analysis and a cow+orc logo joke.
author: Simon Willison

title: Generative coding: 10 Breakthrough Technologies 2026
description: MIT Technology Review names 'Generative coding' as one of the 10 Breakthrough Technologies for 2026. The article covers how AI's ability to write software code has quickly become one of the technology's first real use cases for business. Discusses tools like Copilot, Cursor, Lovable, and Replit, and how AI coding tools are changing entry-level coding jobs and the software development industry.
author: MIT Technology Review

title: We asked over 150 software engineers about vibe-coding. Here's what they said
description: Business Insider surveyed 167 software engineers about 'vibe-coding' (AI-assisted coding). Key findings: 46.9% feel they're 'keeping up' with AI tools, 17.5% are opting out entirely, and 17% feel behind. The article discusses how AI coding tools are changing the industry, with some developers reporting 2-3x productivity gains while others spend more time reviewing AI-generated code. Andrej Karpathy coined the term 'vibe-coding' and recently expressed feeling 'never this much behind as a programmer' due to how quickly AI is reshaping programming.
author: Henry Chandonnet (Business Insider)
